tool.name: Tool3

param.name: startyr
param.pythonReference: The first year of environmental exposure data that you want included in the analysis. Must be XXXX format. Any data from before this year will be excluded and treated as N/A.

param.name: endyr
param.dialogReference: The last year of environmental exposure data that you want included in the analysis. Must be XXXX format. Any data from after this year will be excluded and treated as N/A.

param.name: popd
param.dialogReference: Shapefile containing population density 'exposure' readings for each point.

param.name: timeframes_num
param.dialogReference: Number of time frames you would like to run the analysis over. For example, if you enter "12," the summary statistic will be calculated for 0 years prior to diagnosis year, 1 year prior to diagnosis year, ... all the way to 12 years prior to diagnosis year.

param.name: output_folder
param.dialogReference: The folder that you want all summary exposure .csv files for a given set of input data to be saved to.

param.name: outpath_base
param.dialogReference: Part of the output CSV file path name (to distinguish it from other versions). I.e. "OriginalM1M2_Mortality"

tool.summary: This tool adds population density 'exposure' data for points. It also calculates Median, Sum, Max, or Min summary statistics across a set number of timeframes. Outputs a single .csv file that contains one of the summary statistics across all timeframes.
